Rex woke to bright, sterile lights which aggravated his already splitting head. The world was an unwelcome intrusion and he did not raise his head because he knew, even before the surgeons had placed the plastic hissing cup over his unwilling snout, what he would be waking up to. Still groggy and dazed with drugs, he felt no pain, but by the abominable itching in his crotch, Rex already knew they were gone. The realization hit him like a hammer and he felt himself unmade, half a dog and unable to perform his functions as nature intended; no matter that he had a family and five adorable pups at home, Rex felt he had been brutalized and perhaps even that a part of his essence had been taken. He curled on himself within the cool steel cage in which he was enclosed and wanted nothing more than to lick where the stitches itched, but even this simple act of remorse was prevented by the ridiculous fan which enwrapped his entire head.

Things did not improve upon his return to his home two days later. Despite his mate Lulu’s reassurances, Rex remained convinced that he was damaged beyond repair and moped about the house, paying only cursory attention to the young ones and often finding comfort in his daily meal and frequent snacks. “Because of the surgery,” Rex thought to himself, “I’m destined to be nothing more than a fat, lazy lump on the couch; it’s not fair!” And yet even as he thought this, he filled his gullet from his bowl in the evenings, often licking its clean metal surface until one of the human children would take pity on him and fill it up again. And if he felt a decrease in his overall energy, it was hardly to be noticed for the time he spent sulking in the living room, contemplating how now all of his friends would be able to outrun and out distance him easily. Lulu took it all in stride, staying by her partner’s side, certain that in time, he would recover, mentally as well as physically.

About a week and a half after Rex came home, the broad white fan was removed from his head and Rex was no longer walking stiffly with his hind legs, though the lack of the familiar weight was a constant distress for the red-furred canine. He and lulu were idling in the living room before the wide glass doors when the dog clattered and little Tommy, Rex’s rotund third son, clamored over the threshold. The little setter pup climbed in panting in near exhaustion from the heat and play of the backyard in which the other pups frolicked; of course he was the first one to be fatigued. He lay for a few moments on the cool tile of the kitchen ceramic, legs spayed out for maximum surface area, though Tommy was able to cover more ground than the average pup due to the width of his middle. Rex thought vaguely that something ought to be done about Tommy, whose weight was now just shy of a full 30lbs, a full third more than his slim siblings, but he didn’t want to commit to anything at the moment.

Tommy eventually wandered over to his parents, belly swinging slightly on his undersized frame and he stared a long time at Rex before saying innocently, “Daddy, you look like Mama.”

If anyone other than his own son had said that, he’d have risen up instantly and bitten someone’s toe off. As it was, he was confounded on how to act. Lulu reacted instantly when she saw Rex’s expression, “Now, Tommy, that’s not a very nice thing to say to your father. Say you’re sorry.”

Tommy’s mouth worked the air in protest, but under Lulu’s severe glance, he said hurriedly, “I’m sorry, But I just meant Daddy’s big like you.”

Now it was Lulu’s turn to feel self conscious, despite the fact that the pup was plainly oblivious to the effect he was causing. Rex rotated his head around to look at his flank and did notice for the first that that he and his spouse now indeed shared almost identical physiques (more identical indeed than Rex would have liked). Still rather chubby from her well nourished pregnancy, Lulu was not what Rex would have called fat, but she certainly wasn’t as trim as he was, or at least used to be. There was a considerable softness on his ribs now, and the line formed by his belly, rather than tapered, was almost parallel with his back. His hips too were less defined, where bones had angled his hindquarters gently, there was now a simple smooth curvature. Not a very significant change, but certainly a mighty one given the time he had been at home. Rex finally snorted when he emerged from his thoughts, “I guess I should take it easy on the kibble eh, hun?” He rubbed noses with her while Tommy trotted off hastily.

By that evening, however, habit trumped his nearly forgotten words. Tommy watched as his father gorged himself and plunged his snout into his bowl, lifting his head every few moments to observe his stance and imitate it himself. Though it hurt to stuff himself so, Tommy finished his whole bowl—Just like Daddy!—despite that fact that his family had exchanged his puppy bowl for an adult one in lea of Tommy’s prodigious appetite. Tommy even managed to lick the bowl afterwards and was rewarded with seconds. He wasn’t able to finish a fourth of the second portion, even though he ate until he was sick and his great round belly bulged and swayed heavily under him, but he was sure that in time he would do better.

Colors had lost their flare, food was tasteless and it was hard to keep track of how much he was actually eating save how many times a day his bowl was refilled. His puppies gamboled outside the big bay windows where he sat and watched them everyday but he couldn’t ever seem to muster up the energy to go and chase them the way he did before the surgery. He even slacked on his protective duties to warn the household of dangerous mailmen and passing cars.

His spouse, Lulu, quietly accepted Rex when he came home, thinking that this was just a temporary funk from which he would eventually recover. However, after several months, the altered setter had not changed significantly. Sure, after a while he no longer wandered around the house at night, quietly moaning to himself, but the vigor that was in him before seemed entirely absent, replaced by a worn acceptance of habit. Now, more than a season since the surgery, Lulu watched as Rex lumbered up to take his ablutions in the yard. He walked a little stiffly, working out the kinks in his legs and then squeezed himself through the dog door. Sure he did not seem so sad anymore, but neither did he seem particularly happy and Lulu was increasingly worried that it might be too late to work out a change she had assumed would come on its own.

The setter female watched the now much larger male amble out into the grass. It was painfully clear the effect that his poor eating habits had had over the intervening months. At first it had seemed a good thing, the more Rex ate during a day, the better overall he seemed especially during the first painful weeks after the surgery. Now however, he had settled into a routine of almost sickening gluttony. Three whole bowls of kibble in the morning and two more in the evening and he still begged constantly, obtaining sometimes an equal volume of rich human stuffs on days that the family sat down for dinner and had lots of leftovers. Boy did it show.

Rex’s long, auburn fur could not hide the vast swathes of fat that liberally coated his back, belly, chest, neck and rump. His profile was that of a wide rectangle whose bottom terminated close to the ground, far closer indeed than due solely to his new tank-like belly for the length of the auburn fur on his stomach. He was now more than twice as wide as Lulu herself, wider even than she had been stuffed and carrying five pups in her belly. It was strange watching the thick fat on Rex’s back tip to the right and then to the left as he took his measured steps across the lawn. She averted her eyes as he crouched, the thick body now stubbornly difficult to bend and she knew that he was having some difficulty maintaining the position long enough to do his business.

Lulu turned away from the window then, more to escape the sight of what seemed to be the results of her mate’s efforts to eat himself to death, than any pretense of privacy; it was so much easier to pretend the problem didn’t exist when it wasn’t staring you in the face. The female setter sighed deeply and retired to the comfort of chewing an old, worn slipper than she had had since moving in. The corners of her mouth curled in memory. The world had been so much bigger then, if somewhat louder and more frightening, the human children barely more than infants and herself still wet behind the ears and craving her mother’s milk. The mother and father had scurried to and fro in care of their brood, only settling down at night to relax with the downy fluff of the new pup. Rex had already been there a year and he seemed so strong, sophisticated and mature, stealing the slipper for her one night when she had been feeling lonely and neglected. He had torn his promptly to pieces, but Lulu had always been gentle with her toys, savoring them as one might a hard candy, or perhaps more like a security blanket. At the time, she had had no conception that after having pups of her own, her own life could begin to mirror those of her adopted human family, nor that her and Rex’s roles could be so totally flipped on their heads.

‘You got in the way a little bit back there,’ he thought to his stomach. ‘Maybe I should do something about it,’ and he walked off to find his mother, Lulu.

He found her napping in front of the fireplace, on the threadbare hearthrug, with her back to the flames. He looked at her thoughtfully from the doorway, studying her physique. She was naturally a normal sized dog, as he could see from the family photograph on the wall, taken before she had children, but her pregnancy had changed his mothers form. There was now a little excess fat on her tummy, as she had eaten to a certain degree of excess during pregnancy, as encouraged by those around her. Little Tommy strode a little uneasily into the room, and nosed her softened belly. He quickly sat back on his haunches, as a small moan escaped her lips, and her eyes opened slowly. Glancing around momentarily, they found the disturbance, and she smiled.

“What is it baby?” she asked him sofly.

“Well, mummy…”

“Yes dear?”

“You know how I’m a little… big for my age?” and he could see her eyes linger on his spherical stomach.

“Yes?” she whispered.

“Well, don’t you think there’s a bit of an issue with it?” he asked, and she smiled once again.

“Come here Tommy,” she murmured, patting a spot by her side with her paw. Tommy inched his way over to her mother’s warm bulk, and lay his head gently against her side. His mother moved her forepaw over his head, and to his stomach. She rested it softly on his flab, stroking the puppy, and spoke again.

“I don’t see any problem at all with you Tommy,” she said reassuringly. “You’re a wonderful son to me and your father, and this,” she continued, giving his pudge a playful squeeze, making the puppy giggle, “is nothing to get flustered about dogs come in all sizes. I’m a little heavy at the moment, and there’s nothing wrong with a chubby belly: Especially when it makes you this cute!” and she gave another squeeze, before letting go of him. Tommy walked around to face her head-on, smiling too.

“Feel better now?” she asked her son.

“Yes I am Mummy. Thank you,” and he rubbed his head against her muzzle. She returned his affection, adding,

“Remember Tommy, I’ll always love you, no matter how big you are, now go and play with your brothers and sisters. They’ll be wondering where you’ve got to,” and she closed her eyes again, about to nod-off.

Tommy now felt a lot better about himself, and his weight. ‘There’s nothing wrong with a chubby tummy’ he reminded himself, and beamed. The little Setter trotted off to go back outside, but was being followed by something. Tommy stopped as he heard footsteps behind him, and looked around.

It was Sophie, one of the children in the family that owned him. She was six years old, with shoulder length black hair and bright blue eyes, gazing down at him from her great height. Tommy was never sure how tall she was, but could tell her head came up to the same level as those strange switches that click an make the room bright.

“There you are little guy!” she said chirpily, and picked him up. Tommy liked being handled and stroked by the humans, and he allowed himself to be carried by the little girl. She plucked him gently from the ground, and held him to her chest as she walked upstairs to her room.

“Oof Tommy, you are heavy,” she said, caressing his back as his added poundage made the ascent a little harder. She made the climb, and crossed the landing to her room, closing the door quietly behind her. It was growing dark outside, so she closed the curtains and flicked the light switch to provide illumination. She plonked the puppy down on her bed, and lay next to him, stroking and playing with the pup while she watched television. Tommy lay casually and relaxed as her small hands (but large to him), made work of patting his body, finding that her hands would usually stray to his stomach, kneading and patting the soft form. She was not too dissimilar to himself in this area. The little girl was also slightly overweight for her age. She sported a small potbelly, a doughy look and hints of a double chin. Tommy eased his head into the girls flab as the latter stroked at his own, and relaxed, in almost total comfort.

After a little while, she picked him up underneath his shoulders, and lay almost flat on her back, looking down her front. She stood the little Setter on her tummy, and his paws sunk in slightly to the flab, as he found support.

“You are a pudgy little puppy, aren’t you?” she asked, smiling playfully, “you‘re a bit like me, you are,” she said, and tickled his exposed underbelly. Just then, Sophie heard a voice from downstairs, and let him down gently, as she heard her own mother calling her down for dinner, and opened the door to let Tommy out, as he had his meal at the same time. He bounded down the stairs, and went for his food tray.

All of the puppies ate from the same tray of food, but there was no real competition for it as it was always well filled by the human family. This also allowed them to eat as much as they wanted, which was a lot for Tommy. As he chatted idly with his family, he also chewed his way through the kibble as if there was no tomorrow, and put away a decent portion of the tray by the time he was sated, but went for a nice drink as well, as his running around earlier had built up quite a thirst.

He felt very full afterwards, and his tummy was very taught. However, the fullness, combined with his earlier exercise, also made him feel very drowsy and sleepy, so the Setter decided to go to bed earlier than normal. He went to his parents and told them where he would be, in case they wondered where he was.

“Well, someone had a good dinner,” said his father, Rex, as he waddled due to his meal, into view. “You alright son?” he asked.

“I’m going to bed now,” replied Tommy wearily, “I feel really tired for some reason.” Both his parents glanced at his overfilled stomach for a minute, then at each other’s eyes, in silent agreement.

“’Night then dear,” said Lulu, and she nuzzled her son lovingly. Rex did the same, and the puppy plodded to the den of old pillows and blankets, in a small spare room with a doggy door. He made himself comfortable, adjusting his sleeping position for his tight stomach, and drifted off to sleep.

Tommy opened his eyes sharply, and raised his head. In the gloom, he saw a mass of fuzzy shapes, rising and falling softly, with heavy breathing as backing. He heard another noise, this one quieter than the first, as though whatever making it was being more careful. The Setter got up, and walked off in search of the noise.

111322.title: After they stop playing, Tommy goes to find his...

1113221.content:
As his eyes were not quite adjusted to the darkness surrounding him, Tommy couldn’t be sure who it was that he could see. He was, however, able to make out a small, fuzzy shape, almost buried in one of the cupboards and the white door of the unit open behind it. The auburn pup could also hear the sounds of something straining, as though trying to move something far too heavy for itself, combined with occasional sighs.

Tommy moved closer to the shape, trying to discern who or what the intruder was. As he got closer, he could make out a fluffy appendage swishing this was and that, transfixing him as the cogs in his mind whirred away working out what this was. ‘It’s a tail,’ he thought, solving the puzzle. By now, he could see better in the gloom, and saw that the fuzzy shape was in fact the hindquarters of a dog. A small dog, of his breed. It was one of his siblings.

Staying silent as possible, Tommy scanned the figure, to see who it was. He could see that the pup before him was quite thin and fit, with a smooth waist. It couldn’t be one of his brothers, they sported rounded bellies like himself, so that left Dora and Sarah. Remembering that the former had longer, shaggy fur on her underside, he peered at the straining female. She had smooth, short hair on he stomach, which meant it was,

“Sarah?” whispered Tommy, and she stopped her forepaws pressing against the cabinet. Sarah reversed out of the opening, looking at where she heard the noise emanate from. When she found Tommy, he could see her eyes open wide.

“Tommy, what are you doing up?” she asked, sounding jumpy, and to her brother as though she was trying to hide something.

“I heard something in here,” he answered bluntly, determined to find out what his sister was up to, “but what are you doing in there? Isn’t that the place where they keep our food?” referring to the large sack of dry kibble that Michael kept in the cupboard.

“S-so it is,” replied Sarah, barely audible. Her ears were back and she was looking down at the floor.

“Well what are you doing in there?” pressed Tommy. Sarah looked up at her brother, directly into his deep brown eyes, and heaved a sigh, before answering.

“I was getting something to eat,” she said, almost solemnly.

“But why, you only ate a little while ago? You can’t be too hungry?” Sarah looked at her brother downcast, and replied to his blunt questions.

“I did it because I want to be like you,” she replied, looking as though a great weight had been lifted from her shoulders. Tommy was puzzled though. How could she be like him?

“How could you be like me?” he asked, genuinely perplexed.

“I want to get fatter, like you do,” and Tommy finally realised what she was doing. ‘She’s going to stuff herself silly to try and gain weight!’ he thought, surprised. He had always been slightly jealous of his sisters’ trim waistlines and fitness. How they could play for hours and not feel exhausted, and how much they could outrun himself.

“But why? Why would you want to be like me?”

“Because the family loves you!” she replied, breaking out into a smile. “You get to laze around pretty much all day while the humans pet you and hug you. You get to eat all that you want, and go to bed almost bursting from dinner. And look at you: You’re a cute, squishy little puppy and they love you for it. I just wanted to get a part of that love and affection that they seem to give to you because of your tummy,” she finished, and dropped her head once again, very upset. Instinctively, Tommy rushed to his sister’s side, and nuzzled her lovingly, his warmth comforting the gloomy puppy. After about a minute of just standing together, Tommy spoke.

“I’m sorry for being so forward with you,” he said to her softly. “I didn’t know you felt that way.”

“You mean, you aren’t upset?”

“Why would I be upset? All your doing is putting some meat on your bones, which you look like needing!” he replied happily, and his sister giggled in response.

“I just thought you’d not like it if I took the family’s love from you.”

“Well, I’m not.” Sarah licked the side of his face in gratitude, before returning to the cupboard. Tommy also hopped onto the veneered wooden surface, and helped her to drag the open bag of food so that the opening was accessible for them. They dropped back onto the linoleum floor of the kitchen.

“I’ve done this a few times now,” said Sarah, back to her normal, cheerful self.

“You have?”

“Yep, I think it’s had an effect, all this eating,” Sarah said peering back at herself, “at least, I feel heavier.”

Tommy pressed his cold, wet nose to Sarah’s warm stomach. She wasn’t fat by any means, and if she had swelled with fat, it was barely noticeable to the eyes of the pup. But as he felt his sister’s body, there was a certain softness to her tummy, that was not there before, and Tommy could feel his nose push in slightly, indicating that there was definite growth in his sister.

“You definitely feel softer, sis,” he said, rubbing against her gently, feeling her small layer of fat ripple a little, “soon you might be as big as I am!” Sarah beamed.

“You were always the bigger one Tommy, I think you’ll always be,” she replied, before plunging her head into the bag of crunchy morsels. She gulped down several small mouthfuls of them, but stopped quite quickly, and raised her muzzle again, licking her chops thoroughly, savouring the meaty taste.

“You want to join me?” she asked, smirking.

Tommy didn’t know how to respond. He felt reassured about his gain now that Sarah was also going to be expanding, and he certainly felt happier about it. But his large dinner was still, for the most part, resolutely in his gut, undigested and leaving the puppy feeling quite full and stomach heavy still, and he wasn’t sure if he should eat again tonight.
1113221.title: Someone he knew

11132211.content:
“Well, I’m not sure Sarah. I still feel full from dinner,” he began, but Sarah cut him off.

“Oh come on Tommy, I promise you’ll like it,” she replied in mock anger, “you should know more than me how good it feels to be stuffed with food.” She looked at her brother with round, pleading eyes, and Tommy’s reservations melted away.

“OK then sis, I’d love to join you,” he said, and smiled at his sibling.

“Yay!” she whispered happily, and put her head back in the bag to continue eating. Tommy followed suit after looking at her for a few moments. ‘I still can’t believe she wants to get fat’ he thought to himself, still a little bemused by his sister’s antics. He buried his muzzle in the kibble, and began eating to try and take his mind off it. ‘Well, she is right about being stuffed!’ he reminded himself, and merrily began chomping away on the morsels, before hearing an alarmed noise from beside him.

“Shhh,” Sarah hissed, and Tommy raised his head.

“Remember, you have to be quiet when you’re eating,” she told him, “or we might get caught!”

“Sorry.”

“It’s fine,” she whispered back cheerfully, “but just keep it down a bit.”

So they returned to their eating. Tommy salivated as he chowed down on kibble, feeling the crunchy morsels join the previous meal in his bulbous tummy. His midsection swelled slowly and steadily with the influx of nourishment, becoming tighter and tighter as his stuffing wore on, but the little Setter was happy. He was more than happy. The delight of gorging on the delicious food was sending Tommy into euphoria, but soon he had to stop. The pleasure of stuffing was starting to be overturned by the protestations of his pressured stomach.

Tommy moved away from the bag, and lay down in a curled position, around his now taut belly. He could feel the grub inside him, sloshing and shifting as he digested his meal. The puppy beamed, ‘no wonder Sarah likes this’, he thought, and dazed in the euphoric feeling of it all, as he began to imagine himself swelling and growing with newfound pudge from his midnight snacking.

Sarah kept going with her stuffing, and was moving into the bag of food little by little as she worked her way through the kibble. She loved the feeling of being rounded with a heavy portion of food, and as she ate, Tommy watched in the gloom of the slightly moonlit kitchen. He could see her sister’s midsection getting more and more spherical, pushing outwards to the sides and underneath her currently lithe frame.

Eventually, after the pressures of the excess food in Tommy’s belly had quelled slightly, Sarah also picked her head up, satisfied with her meal, and she moved over to join her brother in lying on the floor. She rested her head on his more cushiony tummy, reminiscent of her actions earlier that day, and smiled.

“I love this,” she said, adjusting her body slightly.

“What?” asked her brother, moving his head down to face her. He watched as her burgeoning midsection raised and fell as his sister breathed in and out, before she answered.

“This,” she emphasised her word, wriggling her head a little to indicate the pillow-like softness of her brother. “You’re just so adorably cute and cuddly, even more with this big tummy to squeeze!”

“Aw, thanks Sarah,” murmured Tommy, and licked the end of her snout, causing her to giggle once again. She jumped up, and nosed at the same belly she had just lain on, her startlingly cold nose making Tommy jolt slightly.

“Come on, we better get back to bed, before we fall asleep in here,” she said, grinning. She was aware from her previous night binges that a fully filled stomach was an excellent aid for sleeping. “I’ll need your help to get the bag away.”

“Alright, give me a moment,” replied Tommy, and started to heave herself up. Sarah may have begun to overeat, but she was still much fitter then him, and was able to move much more easily in her stuffed form. Tommy heaved himself to his paws, the claws in his toes making quite clicking noises as he stood up. The food was a heavy weight in his gut, and now that he was standing, it was shifting once again.

He walked over to the bag, being tested by the pains in his belly to remain as silent as he could. He and Sarah took a corner of the bag in their mouths, and pulled it into the wooden cupboard. But, as it moved up the ledge from tiles to wood, a few mouthfuls of kibble spilled out of the opening and onto the floor, which went unnoticed as the pups worked to get the sack away.

After a short while, they succeeded despite the impediment of being so full. They hopped back down, and Sarah felt a few of the morsels under her paws, the velvet skin helping to soften the impact. Tommy walked back to the door, but stopped when he realised that Sarah wasn’t beside him. The pup spun around, and saw her with her muzzle to the floor, hovering up the pieces as she sniffed them out. He watched her go about her covering-up, wondering how she could still find room for the extras.

Presently, she raised her head, swallowed the last few fragments, and smiled at her brother.

“Hey, I needed to make sure we don’t get found out,” she whispered, after seeing that Tommy was staring at her.

“I know, I was just trying to work out how you could still eat after all that. You must be bursting!”

“Hee hee,” she chuckled, “I’m a growing girl.”

“You really are,” Tommy added, raising a forepaw to her tummy when she drew alongside him, feeling how solid it was compared to earlier. It wasn’t too much bigger than before, her waist still curved upwards behind her ribs, but it was noticeable from this close that she had eaten a lot. She looked like she had swallowed one of the small balls that they played with when the sun was shining on the garden.

“Do you think someone will notice that we’re so big in the morning?” Tommy asked. He could tell that his own stomach had stretched out too, and the extra size would surely make someone suspicious.

“Oh, Don’t worry about that,” Sarah reassured him, “like I said I’ve already eaten like this. As long as you don’t eat much more than you would at dinner, the lump always goes down by when you wake up!”

“How did you work that out?” Tommy asked, a wry smile starting to form on his maw.

“Well,” Sarah began, sounding a bit embarrassed, “ a few days ago, I really made a pig of myself. I must have eaten that time what I’d normally eat all day, and well, I paid for it in the morning.”

“What happened?”

“I still felt a bit full when I woke up, and my belly still pushed out a bit. At least you and the others had left me to sleep and already had breakfast, so I could eat without anyone noticing my tummy. I went upstairs then until the bulge went down.”

“So that’s where you went,” Tommy remembered that he didn’t see Sarah till well after the sun had reached its highest. “But why did you have more if you were still showing?” he asked, and Sarah grinned.

“Well, I was hungry,” she countered, and playfully nudged her brother’s side.

“I get it,” and the male Setter smiled. “Thanks for sharing your snack with me sis,” he said, grateful for the wonderful experience he’d had.

“I should be thanking you bro, you said you’ll keep this a secret,” and she nuzzled his side.

“And I will,” replied Tommy, returning her affections.

The two slowly crept back to the den, tired from being up so long in the middle of the night. Padding their way back through the semi-darkness, they got back to the pillow-strewn room where the rest of their family continued to slumber deeply. Tommy and Sarah quietly said goodnight to each other before settling down on the cushions and closing their eyes.

Tommy did not stay awake for long, but his last conscious thoughts were of doing this again. As he drifted off to sleep, he began to dream of the future. In it, he was a gloriously tubby dog, proudly waddling his overweight body around the home, to the repeated affections of the human family, who fondled his supple flab and fed him repeated treats of beef and turkey. The fattened Setter lolled over onto his side, tired from the exertion of his walking, and lazed around with Sophie cuddling up to his massive body, stretching his legs out in ecstasy as her fingers caressed him. Tommy stretched out in the real world, and writhed a little to work himself into a more comfortable position, and he carried on his wonderful dream.
11132211.title: Tommy says "Yes."

111322112.content:
The flawless vision of his possible future self ended seemingly too soon, as the little Setter thought. He barely had time to enjoy his expanded form, when the sun was piercing it’s way into the den. The night-time feed had tired him out, and he desperately wanted to stay in his stupor, but Tommy’s eyelids opened up to the glare and blinked in the early sunlight. Tommy looked around. Only he and Sarah were still left, though his sister was still gently snoozing a few cushions away.

Hearing the yips and occasional barks outside of Matt, Alfie and Dora as they gambolled about the garden, Tommy reasoned that it must be mid morning. Breakfast would still be in the tray, there was always some food left in it, but he reasoned that they better get moving soon, or Mummy might come looking. They’d have a bit of difficulty explaining why they were still left in the den ages after they had risen; normally, the pups, including Tommy, would wake her up.

Padding over to Sarah, he nosed her middle to rouse her. She was right, it had definitely gone down. ‘The perfect crime!’ Tommy though giddily to himself, as his the thinner one awoke.

“Morning Bro!” she chirped as she saw who it was. “Why’d you wake me up?”

“I figured you’d want breakfast,” Tommy replied, before dropping to a whisper, “You’ve got a tummy to keep up now,” glancing at her waistline. While it had gone down since her meal, Tommy could see the ever so slight changes to her physique that were happening.

Sarah smiled and gently batted a paw at his muzzle in a playful mood. Her brother walked off after hearing a rumble from deep within his furred mass, and headed for the tray. Sarah shifted on the pillow, rolling to her feet. Shaking her head a little to force away her drowsiness, she trotted off to join him at the food tray.

Outside, the other three siblings continued their game of chasing each other around the lawn, still a little damp from the autumn dew. Rex was standing by on the concrete patio by the screen doors, watching over his precious offspring, guarding them from the deadly, deadly pigeons and blackbirds that scoured the garden for grubs. As he resolutely sat, ready for action, his mind was pondering where his other two children were.

The answer to that was that after their nourishment, they had found a comfy spot in front of the fire, on the hearthrug next to Lulu. As they lay there, the human children would pet and stroke them, while gazing at the rectangular screen while strange things happened inside it. Though they had both just been asleep, the human children would want a comforting furry thing to play with while their cartoons were on, and the pair were only too happy to oblige.

Eventually, the Saturday morning cavalcade ended, ad the children departed the living room. Lulu had since left with Michael who took her for a walk on weekends when he felt he had time, and this left the pups alone. Feeling as though they needed a little air, the two ambled into the garden via the open kitchen door.

Rex spotted them as they went to join the others. ‘At least they’re here now,’ he thought, relieved, and watched as they joined the fun. The older Setter’s gaze followed them as they frittered around on the grass, the sun shining down merrily despite the slightly chilly air the occasional gust of wind brought. Tommy looked as though he was lolloping at the back as usual, and this concerned Rex.

He knew exactly why he was not keeping up, the great dome of the chubby puppy’s roundness highlighting itself repeatedly with its non-stop undulation as its owner ran. His father sighed. Rex didn’t think anything was wrong with being a little fat. Lulu was at the moment as her softened for reminded him when they snuggled close at night. Besides, winter was coming soon, a little insulation would be useful in the frigid temperature he had come to expect, and they were only puppies. He could vaguely remember himself around that age, festooned with baby fat as he waddled around with his mother, pleading for more milk.

But Rex also saw that ‘nyoose flash’ that had been on the screen only a few days before. A dog in there area was on the screen, a dark brown Labrador as far as Rex remembered, but that wasn’t so clear. What was clear was the dog’s vastness. Its huge, wobbling gut, rolling neck and flabby chest, rippling as the poor creature struggled to walk around for more than a few lengths of its tail, before collapsing on the ground. A human in a blue uniform prodded the shapeless hulk of fur and fat, and watched as it rippled for several seconds of its own accord.

The Setter blocked this memory, trying not to envisage his own son being so monstrously obese, gasping for air. ‘No,’ he firmly put, ‘Tommy’s nowhere near there, he‘s just a bit tubby. He’s just a puppy, he’s got all of his life ahead, he’ll grow out of it: I did. I don’t need to worry about this,’ and Rex looked around and saw that his third son was no longer running around, but standing still, panting heavily.
‘He’s probably just about to have a big growth spurt, that’s all. Tommy isn’t that much bigger than Alfie or Matt anyway.’


Several weeks passed at the house, as the weather drew steadily more wintry. It rarely snowed, but the coldness of the time was all enveloping around the puppies as they would frolic in the garden, and the winds grew stronger. Worried about her young ones, Lulu was scared by the onslaught of iciness.

“Rex honey,” she asked her mate, as he once more cast his eyes over proceedings, “do you think we should keep the little ones inside a little more now. It’s awfully cold out here.”

She had been walked yesterday, and was starting to regret it by the end of her trek. The house, and the nearby village, were situated on a hill, and the roads in and out of the settlement were very exposed. Michael had wisely worn a thick coat and gloves as the stinging gusts dug at his form, but Lulu had relatively minor defences. Her winter coat was building, but the cold had set in too quick for a decent layer to accumulate before it became frigid, and she was now thankful for the slight coating of fat her body still had. At least that had helped to keep her warm as she trod the cold ground, breath rising in mists before her.

“You’re right dear,” replied Rex softly, turning to face her, “but I don’t think we should stop them playing out here. You wouldn’t get any peace otherwise.”

“There nearly six months old now Rex, you don’t need to be looking over them all the time, they’re not stupid.” Lulu had said this gently to her lover. She knew how much he valued their young, and that he felt compelled to make sure nothing bad happened to them.

“But what if something happens?”

“They’ll be fine dear, they’re growing up, there’s bound to be rough and tumble but it won’t do anything bad to them,” she declared rather forcefully, but then dropped her tone, to a loving whisper.

“Besides,” she continued, licking his muzzle as they surveyed the lawn alongside each other, “I miss you when you’re out here.” Rex had no answer for this, and caressed the side of her body.

“I’m sorry love,” he murmured, “we need some quality time together.”

“No need to be sorry dear, you didn’t do anything wrong,” and she smiled at her mate, “come on, there’s a lovely warm spot in front of the fire I’m sure you missed.”

Together, after Rex took one last look at his offspring, they sauntered back into the house, feeling the heat wrap round them in moments, and Rex de-tensed at once. They settled in front of the burning logs, and lay down, simply adoring each other’s company. Rex, always a little fidgety, pawed affectionately at Lulu, causing her to jump a little as she woke from her light doze. Almost as she woke up, she remembered what she saw yesterday.

“Guess what I saw yesterday dear,” she said.

“What?”

“All those ‘crissmuss’ decorations were starting to go up in the town, I saw them as I went by.” Lulu knew Rex loved ‘crissmuss’, and so did she. First the decorations would go up, then the tree would arrive the next day. ‘Better tell the puppies not to mess that,’ she noted. Then the human family would be home more and more, always giving them loving company. But the best thing was the food that they got. Apart from the big meaty bone they each got, a long list of titbits and treats would pass down the Setter throats throughout the holiday period, all of them savoury and delicious.

Naturally, this increased eating would have its inevitable consequences, as Lulu could remember from last year. Her belly would round out, her chest soften and she would generally become more supple as the season wore on, keeping her warm and comfortable in the cold. Rex would go through a similar holiday gain, but both lost it through the rest of the year, no harm done. Besides, she never heard anyone complain about her size.

“That’s great Lulu!” Rex yipped happily, looking forward to the good times he would have. The lazy days just spent dozing around, being almost waited on by the human children, as they lovingly ruffled his fur and gave him ‘mins pyes’ and other such morsels Rex couldn’t name. But as he thought about that, he remembered his burgeoning gut from those delectable things, and his mind drifted back to his children.

Alfie, Matt and Dora were normal and healthy sized, even if a little tubby in the case of the boys. But in the last few weeks, the other two had drifted apart.

Tommy was rounder than ever. He had grown several paw widths in height, but his tummy had grown with it, though slower. It still hung in a pendulous orb below his body, and Rex had started to notice his son’s chest beginning to swell up a bit too, and he was starting to lose sight of his spine. Tommy was still nowhere near what Rex would call fat, but he was more than pudgy now. Sarah had changed too. She’d always been quite lithe and thin, but for around a month now she had been growing alongside Tommy. Her belly was rounding outwards now, though she was still a long way behind her brother.

Rex was a little worried now, but still firmly believed that they would eventually grow out of their puppy-fat. ‘Still,’ he thought, ‘better keep an eye over them at crissmuss,’ and with that, he left that thought alone, as he went back to talking of crissmuss with his darling.

1113221121.content:
Time continued to pass, though the scenery in the house had changed in that time. A large, pointed tree had been placed in the living room, which caused the human children, Greg, Helen and Sophie, to buzz with excitement as Michael carried it into place, steadying it upright in a black plastic tub of stones. A large box was brought in the room by Sally, onto the beige sofa next to the new vegetation, from which the children picked out glittering objects, always topped with a hook or a ring. Some were angels, golden and glistening in the light of the soft glowing bulbs and fire, others were snowmen, pure white and jolly-faced, but the most cherished and prised were the more weathered objects. The ones which weren’t quite finished, or were missing a bit of the design, the ones made by the children.

The whole affair was topped off by Michael placing a large star on the point of the tree. Soon afterwards, the entire house was decorated in the same manner. Long strands of gold, red and green sparkles were hung over the hallway pictures and draped around the ornaments on shelves. Strange little lights were put up all around, flashing and glowing in all different colours. Lulu and Rex had seen all this before, and watched, savouring the moment, but they knew not to be intrusive or be in someone’s path. The children’s minds were elsewhere, or perhaps would be clouded by a mince pie or foil-wrapped chocolate, but either way, they would not always look where they were going, as Alfie found out.

The littlest setter was dozing quietly on the plush sofa cushion after his breakfast, unaware of the activity around him as the tree was assembled. The decorating was finished and still the puppy was asleep, the warmth of being only a few yards from the fire keeping him resolutely in his dreams. After completing their remodelling of the house with yet more shining articles, they returned to the living room to pay their services to Christmas television. Sophie turned the great box on, and a short but piercing and high pitched whistle issued from it. The human ears were spared the noise, unable to pick up such high frequencies, but Alfie wasn’t, an started to stir from his slumber.

The Setter opened his eyes, cloudy in re-awakening, before being fully brought back to reality by a sharp pain in his rear, something heavy pressing down on his tail, and the puppy gave a great yelp. The offender looked down for the source of noise, before standing back up and attempting to calm his victim.

“Oh, Alfie I’m so sorry,” Greg whispered at the auburn Setter. He had been too preoccupied talking to Helen about what he wanted for Christmas to notice the adorably diminutive form he was about to sit on. The ten year old placed his hand on Alfie’s head, and stroked gently, soothing his frightened pet. He then put his hands either side of the six month old canine’s slightly squishy midsection, pulling him upwards and into his lap.

“What did you do Greg?” asked Helen, concerned about the wide-eyed puppy, hearing him squeal but not seeing it.

“I think I sat on his tail,” Greg replied reproachfully. ‘Think?!’ thought Alfie to himself, cocking his head at the boy’s.

“Give him here, Greg,” Helen told her brother, and walked over to him. She plucked the Setter from his grasp, and cradled him in her arms, stroking his fluffy back.

“There, there little guy,” she mumbled to him in a pleasant voice, like his mother would when he was younger, “I’ll find something to make you feel better”.

Alfie’s tail seemed fine after its ordeal, though he could still feel it throbbing as she sat back down in her soft chair with a quiet thud, barely audible over the jabbering elves on screen. The little girl’s blue eyes caught sight of the chubby tummy the dog was the proud owner of, and spied a small stack of festive treats.

“I know!” she cooed at her pet, and picked up a handful of pastry parcels while tickling Alfie’s belly with her other hand. Alfie relaxed, and pressed himself gently against her fluffy sweater, easing into her petting and closing his eyes. A strange smell greeting his nose forced his eyes back open, as she held a yellowy shape in front of his muzzle.

“Come on, eat up,” she urged at him, and the Setter reluctantly obeyed, opening his maw to accept the unknown. The rough, slightly powdery texture his mouth was greeted by, eventually yielded its contents, and Alfie was awash with a tangy and sweet flavour as the sack burst, almost sending him into spasm as the delicious sauce engulfed his tongue. Savouring every last drop of the lumpy innards, he licked his chops afterwards to find some more of the flavour.

“I guess you liked that!” Helen giggled, the eight year old bobbing up and down in her little laugh, before holding another pie within reach of the puppy’s muzzle. Drooling in anticipation, he quickly lunged his head to tear at it, craving desperately for that indescribable zest. He wolfed down another and another of the parcels, until the handful depleted, and Helen settled back down to watch the cartoon.

Alfie picked himself from the warmth of the chair, and stepped down to the floor, his springy legs and the thickly padded carpet helping to cushion the rather heavy impact as he landed, before walking off to find his mother. ‘Maybe Mummy can tell me what that was all about?’ he thought. Though he had become instantly addicted to those morsels, he hadn’t a clue as to why he had been given them so easily. The fullness of his insides and the slight waddle with which he sauntered through the different rooms a testament to his newfound fondness. It had all passed in a blur, but Alfie felt as though he had just had a very large dinner, and it was only mid morning. ‘Too bad our kibble doesn’t taste that good,’ he reasoned to himself. He liked the beef and chicken flavoured chunks, but they could be a bit bland.

Traipsing his stocky form up the staircase, Alfie found Lulu idling on Helen’s bed. The adult Setter looked supremely comfortable on the spongy, purple material, but Alfie felt he had to rouse her.

“Mummy?” he called from the floor below. Lulu opened her eyes, and still half asleep, rolled onto her back, so that now she saw her son upside down and looking a bit worried.

“Are you alright Alfie?” she asked, in a comforting voice, rolling the right way up as she did.

“There’s something going on downstairs, it’s weird, but nice weird. There’s a tree in the corner of the sofa room, and it’s all covered in these sparkly things, plus Helen kept giving me these little parcel things to eat, and they tasted the best Mummy! I’m sure you’d love them!” he said, squeaking in his excitement, bouncing from one paw to the other in his exuberance.

From her son’s rather hyped and bouncy demeanour, and seeing the spittle that had reformed at the sides of his mouth from the thought of these things, the mother Setter had almost deduced what had happened, but she still had to see for herself. Rising unsteadily on the unstable mattress, she gathered herself to jump onto the padded carpet that blanketed the floor, and walked down the hallway. Alfie bounded in her wake, twittering on about these amazing things he ate, the texture, its taste, and just before Lulu felt a little irked by his commentary, they trotted into the lounge.

The dÃ©cor, the smells of rich and warming meals to come, the children beckoning her over, it was all there.

“It’s here!” Lulu whispered under her breath, energised as much as her puppy.

“What’s here?” asked Alfie, still confused.

“Chrissmuss!”

“What’s that?”

“It’s when all the family come together to celebrate their happiness to be together,” she replied, Alfie rapt to her voice. “They sing songs together, give each other presents, and usually just spend a lot of time together.”

“But what about those tangy things I got given, are they part of this?” Lulu smiled down at her son, remembering the first time she got one of the ‘tangy things’.

“It’s the best part for us pets Alfie!” she said vigorously. She looked down at her son, noting the bulging middle he carried around, “all the time you get given treats and food, more than just those tangy things, until you‘re full and nearly bursting. You’ll love it.”

“Really?” Alfie didn’t like the sound of the ‘bursting’.

“Of course you will. This is meant to be the happiest time for everyone, and Michael and Sally make sure that we get to share that too. You better tell your brothers about this, I’ll tell Sarah and Dora.”

“Ok Mummy, I can’t believe we get given those things!” and he licked her under the chin in affection, before seeking out his brothers.

The little Setter searched all around the house. He climbed and descended the stairs several times, a difficulty given his turgid belly, and searched both floors thoroughly but still couldn’t find them, even using his nose to locate them not was helping. Eventually, he gave up looking inside, and went out the doggy-door at the back of the kitchen. It was a tough decision to make for him, as yet more delectable odours wafted into his nostrils as he made for the flap, but kept on course despite his nose telling him otherwise, as well as hearing the wind occasionally howl outside.

The coldness of the outside world hit Alfie hard, and his downy winter fur battled with the wind to keep his tiny form warm, as he shivered on the icy concrete patio, sitting on his furry haunches. The garden was divided into two halves, separated by a now leafless hedge with a gap in to allow traffic between the two pieces of land. Most of the garden in front of this barrier was grassed over, allowing a lot of space for the puppies to frolic on, as well as a small pond in the corner. But behind the hedge, were shallow pits of dark earth, which in summer were awash with rainbow colours and all kinds of aroma were wafted by the breeze as flowerbeds went into bloom.

Alfie swatted at his ear as he squinted at the garden in the winter sun, a particularly teasing gust having raised a firestorm of itches on his floppy skin. Seeing no one in front of the hedge, even his father who had capitulated to Lulu’s desires about his guard dog duties, the little Setter got back up and trudged onto the frosty grass, thinking that they had to be on the other side of the dormant bush.

It's monday morning, time to get up. Misty awoke to the sound of a can opener grinding away at the top of one of her dog food cans. Breakfast was probably Misty's favorite time of day, she got to eat, then rest awhile before she would go out and play in the back yard. While she was eating, Albert (her owner) grabbed his laptop bag and his coffee and gave her a pat on the head before rushing out the door to go to work.

Now that Misty had finished eating, she wandered over to her pillow on the floor to rest for awhile. Then, she decided that she had some buisness to take care of, so she headed for the back yard (Albert left the back door open so she could go when she needed to). After doing that, she decided that it was a good time to see if there was anything new in the yard. She searched high and low, but everything seemed to be the same as yesterday. But wait, Misty thought she heard someone calling her name, but it was too early for Albert to be home. So where was it coming from? She wandered around and saw an elderly woman who had just moved in next door.

Before you start wondering what is going on, let's get a little background info on our next door neighbor. Her chosen carreer before she retired, she worked at an animal shelter. Every day she saw extremely thin and lethargic dogs in need of some serious help. And after she retired, she grew older and less aware. Now her perception for every dog is that it isn't fed enough, so she is always trying to keep dogs from going hungry, even if they don't need it.

Anyway, back to the storyline.

She had never seen this woman before, but she seemed kind and freindly, so Misty decided to greet her. Misty went over and greeted the woman, tail wagging, and the woman gave her a pat on head and then stared at Misty for a minute. Misty was slightly confused by the woman's reaction, but then she seemed to come back to normal. The old woman looked at Misty and asked " are you hungry? You look starved". And with that she went on her way back to her house.

Once again, Misty was rather confused by the woman's sudden leaving, after all, she really didn't have a clue as to what she was saying. Well, except one word, food, that word made sense. Then the woman returned with a bowl and a can of dog food, she laid the bowl on the grass and dumped the contents of the can in the bowl. Misty was surprised that this woman was giving her food at this time of day, Albert only fed her in the morning and the evening, and she had already had breakfast. Did this lady mean that she got more food? She really didn't care, she scarfed up her second breakfast, liked the woman's hand, and retreated to the house, hunger sated once again.

After a good long sleep, Misty heard the woman calling her name again. What does she do?
